dkeep.logic

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • dkeep.logic.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game.java - master class that list the entire game and contain all the components of the game
    Author:
    Rui Guedes and César Pinho
    See Also:
    Door, Drunken, Elements, GameMap, Guard, Hero, Lock, Ogre, Rookie, Suspicious

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkGameStatus()
      Check the position of the hero and if he is captured or killed by a guard, if it is the first level, or a ogre, if it is the second level.
      void initElements(java.lang.String guardType, int ogresNumber)
      Initialize only the necessaries pieces of the gameMap in the right position and quantity.
      char[][] updateMap(char[][] tmpMap)
      Receive a game map and changes it according to the changes previously made to the components of the game, for example, when the doors is unlocked is need change the mark that echoes the door in the map.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(GameMap gameMap,
            java.lang.String guardType,
            int ogresNumber)
        Class constructor specifying the game map, guard type and the number of ogres. Initialize the gameState and map attributes and call the initElements method to initializer the other attributes.
        Parameters:
        gameMap - map of the game
        guardType - initial guard type of the first level
        ogresNumber - number of ogres of the second level

    • Method Detail

      • initElements

        public void initElements(java.lang.String guardType,
                         int ogresNumber)
        Initialize only the necessaries pieces of the gameMap in the right position and quantity. For each mark different of blank or wall (X), it is checked which action to perform.
        Parameters:
        guardType - guard type that needs to be create
        ogresNumber - number of ogres that needs to be create

      • checkGameStatus

        public void checkGameStatus()
        Check the position of the hero and if he is captured or killed by a guard, if it is the first level, or a ogre, if it is the second level. If the hero has been captured, the gameState change to GameOver.

      • updateMap

        public char[][] updateMap(char[][] tmpMap)
        Receive a game map and changes it according to the changes previously made to the components of the game, for example, when the doors is unlocked is need change the mark that echoes the door in the map.
        Parameters:
        tmpMap - game map to be updated
        Returns:
        the updated game map
